heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There is a storm in the vicinity.  This is the first storm since 02 October 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: At the moment, it is not a cold snap.  This year has seen 6 cold snaps; typically, 3.7 cold snaps happen every year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is south-westerly (206°).  In the UK, a south-westerly wind often means mild and wet weather.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 2.9°C) and outside temperature (down 2.2°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in pressure (up 9 mbar) and cloud levels (down 137 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 837 m) and rainfall (down 0.6 mm) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 136.7m higher than yesterday, 741.0m lower than the past week, 836.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 568m to 931m and averaged 866.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; comfortable and pleasant temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, pleasant humidity levels and near calm conditions. A few light raindrops may fall, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dim outside. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.

washing.phrase: The current weather conditions are not suitable as it is raining.
